actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to eliminate the requirement that an alien admitted for permanent residence must have lived in the United States for 5 years in order to qualify for supplementary medical insurance benefits (and hospital insurance benefits in certain cases).

summary.text: Revises the Social Security Act to eliminate the requirement that an alien admitted for permanent residence must have lived in the United States for five years in order to qualify for supplementary medical insurance benefits and hospital insurance benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to eliminate the requirement that an alien admitted for permanent residence must have lived in the United States for 5 years in order to qualify for supplementary medical insurance benefits (and hospital insurance benefits in certain cases).
